> Hi, (Im new to the group)
> No actual plans as yet, but have the concept in mind that Im going 
to 
> work into a device. Maybe this will help somewhat...
> 1. Speakjet chip and suitable audio amp.
> 2. PIC microcontroller, configured to talk to Speakjet serial port 
at 
> 9600 baud, including baud sync and flow control feedback from SJ.
> 3. An array of "speak" (ascii)commands programmed into PIC to 
initiate 
> outputting of all specific allophones, as per the Speakjet 
datasheet.
> 4. External sensor of some form (perhaps EMF) that is able to act 
as 
> environmental trigger for allophone speaking.
> 5.PIC sub-routine to allow PIC to read and digitize the sensor 
analog 
> output via the PIC's A/D input(s).
> 6 PIC sub-routine to link incoming sensor data to the selection of 
> allophone output, depending on sensor level thresholds, etc and 
perhaps 
> a random selection process.
> 
> There is a Yahoo group dedicated to the Speakjet chip, but it wont 
be 
> of much help in this case. The core work is in the PIC programming.
> 
> Think thats about it for now. Hope this helps.
> regards from "down under",
> JEFF
>
